main_definition: A headline is a prominent title or statement used in newspapers, magazines, or online articles to capture attention and summarize the main point of an article.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In journalism, a bold, concise line at the top of newspaper or magazine articles intended to attract readers' attention
meanings_and_examples.example: The local news headline read 'Massive Flood Devastates Local Community.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: A catchy phrase used in advertising to draw attention and promote a product, service, or event
meanings_and_examples.example: The new car model's headline ad said 'Revolutionize Your Driving Experience with Our Cutting-Edge Technology.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: A slogan used by politicians during campaigns to convey their key messages and differentiate themselves from opponents
meanings_and_examples.example: 'Stronger Economy, Better Education for All' was the headline of the candidate's political manifesto.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An attention-grabbing phrase or statement used in social media posts to engage viewers and convey a message quickly
meanings_and_examples.example: 'Unmissable Event! Join Us for an Evening of Celebration' was the headline of a Facebook event invitation.
